findings.title: Denial of Service via gas exhaustion in emptyCreditors
findings.explanation: Resetting a large dynamic storage array by assigning `creditorAddresses = new address[](0)` requires O(n) storage writes equal to the current array length. If the array grows large (beyond thousands of entries), clearing it in a single transaction can exceed the block gas limit and revert, preventing `win` from ever being set.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a more gas-efficient pattern: replace the array with a mapping or track a version counter instead of clearing the entire array, or implement incremental deletion across multiple transactions rather than a single full clear.

unmatched_predictions.title: Denial of Service via gas exhaustion in emptyCreditors
